news_header: Far-right leaders attended Trump's inauguration, highlighting a global alliance of anti-globalists united by nationalism and anti-migration sentiments.
news_original_title: How the far right is expanding its international network
news_text: Representatives from Germany's far-right AfD party, along with other international right-wing leaders, attended Donald Trump's inauguration in January 2025. This event underscores a growing global alliance of ultra-nationalists, including figures like Steve Bannon and various influencers. Experts note that these far-right networks are united by opposition to migration, nationalism, and anti-globalization, aiming to reshape the ideological landscape in favor of social conservatism. Despite their current success, political scientists believe that moderate forces can still counteract their influence if democratic institutions function effectively.
